tournament.name: Duel Commander Mensal - 09/07 - Academia de Jogos

decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing a wide range of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and pressure the opponent. With a strong mana base and efficient ramp options, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Jenara, Asura of War and Sword of Feast and Famine. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive creatures like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage, along with a suite of counter spells and removal options to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggression with disruption and control elements, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a one-on-one setting.

The deck focuses on using mana dorks to ramp quickly and efficiently into big threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. It also includes various utility creatures like Reclamation Sage and Acidic Slime to deal with opposing threats. With cards like Scapeshift and Realms Uncharted, the deck can quickly assemble powerful land combos to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith allows for flexibility in tutoring for key pieces. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and use the commander, Titania, Protector of Argoth, to generate value from lands entering the battlefield and create an unstoppable aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the commander, Animar, Soul of Elements, to play a fast-paced combo strategy. By utilizing a variety of mana dorks and creature spells, the deck aims to quickly amass a board presence and generate infinite mana in order to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth or Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. The deck includes cards like Ancestral Statue and Cloud of Faeries to help generate additional mana or trigger Animar's ability to reduce the cost of creature spells. It also includes key interaction cards like Venser, Shaper Savant and Glen Elendra Archmage to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm opponents with a powerful board presence and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this control deck is to ramp up mana quickly using a variety of mana dorks, spells, and land fetch cards to be able to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck aims to control the game through removal spells, land destruction, and powerful planeswalkers like Garruk Wildspeaker and Karn Liberated. Nissa, Vastwood Seer serves as the commander, providing card advantage and helping to ramp up mana. The deck also includes a variety of tools for deck manipulation and card advantage like Sylvan Library and Survival of the Fittest. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and out-valuing them through controlling the game.

The deck revolves around using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through a combination of card draw, manipulation, and counterspells. The key strategy is to efficiently draw through the deck to find powerful spells like Time Warp, Temporal Mastery, and Temporal Manipulation to take extra turns and outpace the opponent. Utilizing cards like High Tide and Turnabout to generate mana, the deck aims to cast big spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Teferi, Temporal Archmage to further control the board. With a focus on disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to establish dominance through controlling the game tempo and overwhelming the opponent with powerful card plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, board wipes, and disruptive spells while ramping into powerful threats such as planeswalkers and Eldrazi creatures. Jhoira of the Ghitu's ability to suspend high-cost spells for a few turns allows for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence. The deck includes a mix of permission spells, card draw, and versatile removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own win conditions. By efficiently managing resources and knowing when to deploy threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents, ultimately dominating the game with its powerful late-game spells and game-ending creatures.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells, control the board, and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Maelstrom Wanderer serves as the commander, allowing for extra value by cascading into free spells. The deck includes a mix of extra turn spells, board wipes, planeswalkers, and versatile removal options to control the game. It also includes various mana rocks and lands to ensure a smooth mana curve and access to multiple colors. By generating card advantage, disrupting opponents' plans, and accelerating its own game plan, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in 1 vs 1 Duel Commander matches.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana production using various land tutors and accelerators to power out aggressive creatures, such as Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary and Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes cards like Garruk Wildspeaker and Triumph of the Hordes to boost the power of the creatures and overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Scapeshift and Life from the Loam, the deck also has the ability to generate card advantage and strong synergies with the land theme. The inclusion of control elements like Pithing Needle and Krosan Grip helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining the aggressive strategy of the deck.
